metadata: (info { (description "Kokonag'n is a game that was played by the Passamaquoddy people of Maine. Unlike other games played by the Passamaquoddy, this one could be played between women and men.") (rules "Resembles checkers. The spaces on the board have different sizes. Round and square pieces. Pieces are marked with different values.") (source "DLP evidence.") (id "1236") (version "1.3.14") (classification "board/war/leaping/diagonal/reconstruction/pending") (credit "Eric Piette") (origin "This game was played in Maine, around 1888.") } ) (recon { (concept "PieceValue" True) })
